title: East Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: hullcoin 'local digital currency ' in lottery bid .
hull woman honoured for ww2 land army role .

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today , but we 're back monday morning from 08:00 .
before i go , let 's have a look at five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
and thanks as always to our bbc weather watchers for their this one was taken in messingham this morning :
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man robbed by group with craft knife in bridlington
text: a 32-year-old man in bridlington has been robbed by four men on bikes with a craft knife .
the victim was walking down an alleyway when the four men threatened him with a craft knife before stealing a £ 20 note and cycling away .
the incident happened on tuesday around 13:45 in an alleyway between holyrood avenue and haslemere avenue in bridlington .
the victim suffered minor injuries and police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: have you seen missing howden man craig farrow ?
text: police are appealing for help to find missing 36-year-old howden man craig farrow who went missing from his home a week ago .
police are concerned because craig has some health conditions which require treatment and he has n't been in touch with his family .

documents.title: watch : demolition of hull 's osborne street car park
text: the car park is being demolished as part of the hull venue project :

documents.title: watch : look north headlines
text: here 's peter levy with the headlines from look north tonight :
tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: sport : st helens v hull fc in super league
text: hull fc could be second in super league after tonight 's clash at st helens - if they win the game .
the club lost a tight match at leaders castleford last week and have named the same squad .
coach lee radford ( thinks st helens have improved under new coach justin holbrook .
radio humberside will have commentary on all frequencies , online and freeview channel 721 with the build up starting in sportstalk at 18:00 .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: court of appeal dismisses challenge by beverley 's lakeminster park residents
text: court of appeal judges have dismissed the latest challenge from residents over the status of a holiday home park near beverley in east yorkshire (
lakeminster park 's chalet owners are being evicted from the site by the east riding of yorkshire council .
this latest case had hoped to overturn the findings of a planning inquiry three years ago , which said that the properties were built there without permission .

documents.title: northern rail strike over next three days
text: the rail union rmt is planning three days of strike action on arriva rail north starting tomorrow .
the action is about the long running dispute over rail safety and driver-only-operated trains .
northern rail says more than 40 % of their normal timetable will run and there will be additional rail replacement buses .
you can check the timetables here .

documents.title: £ 300k to stop young hull men becoming abusers
text: hull city council has been awarded £ 300,000 to support young men aged 16-17 who are at risk of committing domestic abuse .
the money , which has come from the home office , will be spent on a new programme designed to reduce offending rates .

the government changed the national definition of domestic abuse in 2013 and they changed that to reduce the age range to 16 because we know that nearly 50 % of young people are in an abusive relationship if they 're aged 16-24 , so we know that it 's a group that requires those interventions . ''

documents.title: mp : not enough cash to protect all from coastal erosion
text: the mp for beverley and holderness says people in east yorkshire must accept that the money does not exist to protect every community from coastal erosion .
graham stuart ( was speaking during discussions to relocate a water treatment plant near withernsea which is at risk of falling into the sea .

if you look from flamborough head to spurn point you end up coming up with budgets of billions , unless somebody invents some new technology which does n't involve phenomenally expensive amounts of rock being put in the way then i think we 've got to accept as king canute sought to demonstrate in the past , however powerful you might think you are nature is more powerful still . ''
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: outdoor cinema screening in hull
text: people in hull can see the city 's first ever outdoor riverside cinema screening tonight .
stage @ thedock ( will show la la land as part of hull 's film festival .
as well as the showing , there will be impromptu dance lessons from kingston swing and themed food and cocktails .

documents.title: company managing hull venue inundated with enquiries
text: smg , who will be running the hull venue on behalf of hull city council , have been inundated with enquiries about the arena which will hold up to 3,500 people .
we 're excited about the level of interest being shown already and the opportunities for establishing hull as a key part of regional touring for smg .

documents.title: murder arrest over woman 's road death
text: murder arrest over woman 's road death

documents.title: concrete road blocks precaution for hull university graduation
text: concrete road blocks have returned to hull 's queen victoria square .
the defences have been put up as a precaution ahead of the university of hull graduation ceremonies which are being held at city hall next week , the council says .
they were first put up earlier this year after the london terror attacks and the council says it hopes to have a permanent solution in the longer term .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : behind the scenes at hull venue
text: we 've been getting the first look around a new £ 36m concert venue and conference centre being built near the a63 castle street junction in hull .
the venue will hold up to 3,500 people and create 30 full-time jobs and it could bring in around £ 13m to hull 's economy every year .
the work currently underway here is seven months into the construction phase of the project with the opening scheduled for early next year .

documents.title: hull schoolchildren to go barefoot for charity
text: children at hull collegiate school will leave barefoot today as they begin their summer holidays .
they 're being asked to leave their school shoes behind on their desks so they can be given to schoolchildren in africa .
it 's part of a charity initiative called sals shoes .

documents.title: new calls for full inquiry into blood contamination
text: a hull man who was among thousands infected by contaminated blood during the 1970s and 1980s is once again urging the government to hold a full judicial inquiry into why it happened .
glenn wilkinson was diagnosed with hepatitis c in 1983 after a routine operation to remove two teeth at hull royal infirmary .
he describes the contamination scandal as the worst peacetime disaster since the second world war and says it 's time someone was prosecuted .
mr wilkinson has now been backed by a call in the commons by hull north labour mp diana johnson for theresa may to address the issue .
responding , the prime minister said serious allegations have been made and information will be looked at by minsters from the department of health :
but if any honourable member has any further information or evidence they believe will be important - then that should go to ministers . ''

documents.title: hull man arrested after woman dies in crash
text: a man from hull 's been arrested in connection with the death of a woman on the a38 near burton-on-trent in east staffordshire .
the 39-year-old remains in police custody after the collision which was reported at around 20:30 last night .
the woman who died has yet to be identified and police are now carrying out a detailed investigation .

documents.title: man dies after motorcycle crash near barton
text: a 38-year-old man has died after his motorcycle hit a tree in the barton upon humber area .
the incident happened on caistor road , 800 metres from the junction of burnham road at 13:15 yesterday afternoon .
the man died at the scene and police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : dickie bird on joe root
text: a bad cold could n't stop joe root from hitting an unbeaten 184 on his first day as england captain as his side ended day one of the first test against south africa on 357-5 .
an early batting collapse at lord 's had left the hosts on 74 for 4 before root steadied the ship .
he 'll resume alongside moeen ali on 61 this morning .
former test umpire dickie bird told the bbc this morning that he believes joe root is the best yorkshire batsman he 's seen since the great len hutton :
author: Katie Galbraith
Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: job cuts expected at scunthorpe packaging company
text: packaging company mondi has confirmed there may be job losses at its site in scunthorpe .
the firm is proposing to make 60 redundancies at the site , where 140 people currently work .
the changes are designed to streamline operations and improve customer service , according to the company .
it says it 's currently consulting workers and unions about the changes .

documents.title: 'local digital currency ' in lottery bid
text: 'local digital currency ' in lottery bid

documents.title: purse stolen from elderly woman in grimsby
text: an 85-year-old woman had her purse stolen in the middle of the day in grimsby town centre .
a man spoke to the woman before taking her purse , containing cash , from her handbag and making off .
the incident happened on tuesday at about 12:35 on freeman street and police would like to speak to the man

documents.title: watch : hull woman honoured for role she played in ww2
text: a 92-year-old woman from hull will be honoured for the role she played in the second world war - as part of a national event being held later today .
iris newbold was part of the women 's land army and worked on farms during the conflict :

documents.title: humberside police force at 'breaking point '
text: the police and crime commissioner for humberside police ( says the force is reaching breaking point and extra investment is needed after a 20 % increase in calls to 999 .

in a statement , the government says it has protected overall police spending in real terms since the spending review in 2015 and this year humberside police is receiving £ 2m more direct resource funding than in 2015/16 .
there has to be a realisation that with growing demand there is a limit to where efficiency can take us and if there 's demand now , it needs to be resourced now .
the police service at the moment is stretched to the point of breaking . ''

documents.title: watch : what 's on guide to the city of culture
text: kofi smiles takes you through what 's happening over the next week in the city of culture :
author: Ben Horrigan
Digital Video Producer

documents.title: weather watchers : lightning through the lens
text: some of you managed to snap great of the lightning last night .
here are a couple taken in scunthorpe by bbc weather watchers the mews and jojo :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: weather : dry and bright
text: a calmer day today , mostly dry but chances of light rain showers .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: slow traffic on hull main road after accident
text: there 's slow traffic on the a1105 anlaby road eastbound between walton street and arnold street after a severe accident .
the accident happened during the early hours of this morning outside the kcom stadium and the road was closed from around 01:00 until 07:40 .

text: good morning , i 'm caroline and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the area throughout the day .
it looks like we could be in for a lovely day , thanks to one of our weather watchersfor sending in this from harswell this morning :

text: tour of household waste energy plant

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today , but we 're back tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
your news , sport and weather updates will continue through the evening .
before i go , let 's have a look at five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
and it 's been an unusual day weather wise with cloud and sun and some rain expected too .
the sun did break free at one point as you can tell from this taken at far ings nature reserve in barton upon humber :
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: killer patient was 'not psychotic '
text: killer patient was 'not psychotic '

documents.title: cctv in some east yorkshire taxis
text: cctv cameras are being installed in some taxis in a new pilot scheme by east riding council .
it 's hoped the cameras will protect both passengers and drivers with 61 taxis being fitted with them so far .
the scheme is specifically targeting people who work between 01:00 and 04:00 and the council say they 've had a positive response so far .

documents.title: sport : east yorkshire 's kyle edmund out of wimbledon
text: france 's gael monfils ended the hopes of british number two kyle edmund with a straight-set win on centre court .
monfils , the 15th seed , won 7-6 ( 7-1 ) 6-4 6-4 to reach the third round - and leave britain with four players in the last 32 of the singles .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : anyone seen our missing chip ?
text: earlier this week bbc radio humberside launched a portion of hull 's pattie and chips into space but we 've just seen some footage which shows we 've lost a chip :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: grimsby hospital staff reunion raising funds for charity
text: hospital employees from grimsby past and present are coming together for an event to raise money for charity today .
a reunion is open to former employees of old hospitals from the area , as well as current staff from the diana princess of wales hospital .
it 's taking place at the beachcomber holiday park ( to raise money for st andrews hos
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: job adverts go out for grimsby ice rink roles
text: the community group that wants to run grimsby ice rink is now advertising for staff .
grimsby ice rink community will find out next month if their business plan to take over the rink is good enough for north east lincolnshire council which ca n't afford to run it anymore .
ahead of that decision they 've advertised for staff to work at the rink :
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: council 'likely to reject traveller sites '
text: five possible stop-over sites for travellers are likely to be discounted by north east lincolnshire council .
the council were considering the sites , a legal requirement , but they 've told us they do not consider them suitable .
they 've told bbc radio humberside they 'll be drawing up a new list soon which will go out to consultation .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: public meeting about hospital trust in special measures
text: people will get the chance later to find out what action is being taken to get the trust which runs hospitals in grimsby , scunthorpe and goole out of special measures .
the northern lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust was told it needed to improve its quality of care and its finances in the spring .
a public meeting is being held tonight at grimsby town hall ( from 18:00 .

documents.title: bracelet containing dad 's ashes stolen in hull van theft
text: a man is offering a £ 500 reward for the return of a bracelet containing his dad 's ashes which was stolen three months after he died from cancer .
richard moss ( top right ) , 39 , died from a brain tumour in february .
his ashes were put in silver bracelets made for his four sons .
chavez robinson ( top left ) , 21 , said the bracelet was of `` massive sentimental value '' and had been stolen from a van in hull .
police said it was investigating the theft of a van .

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : police targeting kerb crawlers to stop prostitution
text: police in hull say they are doing all the can to deal with prostitution on hessle road .
concerns were raised last month about the number of sex workers operating in the area and there were complaints of an increase in crime .
police community support officer jacqui fairbanks told us what they 're doing to try and help the women :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: man arrested in connection with gilberdyke atm theft
text: a man has been arrested after a cash machine was stolen from a petrol station on main road in gilberdyke , east yorkshire , on tuesday .
a fork-lift truck was used to rip the cash machine from the building during the early hours of the morning .
the 28-year-old man is in custody and being questioned by detectives .
anyone with information about the incident is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: weather watchers : shy flamborough puffins caught on camera
text: it 's a bit of an overcast day , but that has n't stopped our bbc weather watcher mitch clive from snapping these lovely of the puffins at flamborough :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: grotbags actress carol lee scott dies aged 74
text: actress carol lee scott , who was best known as grotbags the witch on children 's tv during the 1980s and early 1990s , has died at the age of 74 .
the character was created in cleethorpes during a summer season when she was performing with rod hull .
her family confirmed the news on social media , with her niece gina mear writing on facebook on wednesday that the actress had `` lost her brave fight against cancer '' .

documents.title: grimsby heritage project shortlisted for national award
text: work to investigate the poignant stories of grimsby 's heroic fishermen during world war one has been recognised .
a project called `` grimsby 's lost ships of ww1 '' is investigating at least 30 of grimsby 's trawler fleet that were lost in the north sea as part of the war effort .
the group 's beaten hundreds to be shortlisted for the uk 's best heritage project and is in with a chance of winning a £ 5,000 prize .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: cigarette ends littering area around hull royal after smoking ban
text: hull and east yorkshire hospitals nhs trust banned smoking at their sites last month but now the area around hull royal is littered with cigarette ends .
callers to radio humberside are divided on the policy with some saying it 's moved the problem on to the street .

in response to concerns raised by patients and members of the public and in order to further promote health and wellbeing , we took the decision to reinforce our 'smoke free sites ' policy last month . ''

documents.title: watch : calls to silence 'britain 's noisiest road '
text: there are calls to to silence the a180 in north east lincolnshire :

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: science fiction being filmed in east yorkshire
text: hull and the surrounding areas will become a film set from today as a collection of short science fiction films are being shot .
the films are part of a project called 2097 : we made ourselves over - jointly commissioned between hull uk city of culture 2017 and aarhus 2017 european capital of culture .
the films will star a number of teenagers from east yorkshire who will also travel to denmark to film in aarhus once filming in england is complete .
the crew were filming at the humber bridge ( during the early hours of this morning .

documents.title: hull 's city of culture volunteers celebrated
text: hull 's city of culture volunteers have been invited to celebratory tea parties from today , to thank them for their efforts in the first half of 2017 .
the volunteers are often seen helping out at city of culture events .
four tea parties have been organised for today so that all volunteers can be accommodated .

documents.title: east yorkshire 's kyle edmund on centre court
text: east yorkshire 's kyle edmund is in action on centre court at wimbledon this afternoon .
the tennis player from tickton won against alex ward on monday to progress into the second round .
he faces french 15th seed gaël monfils and kyle knows it will be a tough match .
he does n't hit the ball hard all the time but when he does it 's effortless and he creates power so he 'll be tough to break down but i 've just got to try and think about my game first . ''

documents.title: police increase patrols around hull 's hessle road
text: police activity has increased around parts of hull , in an effort to try and help women out of prostitution .
that 's according to humberside police who say they 're responding to complaints from people living around hessle road that crime has increased in the area due to a rise in sex workers .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather : chance of heavy rain
text: it will be warm but heavy rain and thunderstorms are possible .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : cloudy with chances of drizzle
text: it will be a mostly cloudy night , with the cloud perhaps thick enough for some patchy drizzle in places , especially over high ground .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : look north headlines
text: here 's peter levy with the headlines from look north tonight :
here 's @ twitterid with tonight 's headlines from @ twitterid join us if you can at 18.30 .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : african dancers perform after mistaking east yorkshire school for one in london
text: teachers at an east yorkshire school got quite a surprise this morning when a group of zulu dancers arrived for an unplanned performance .
the group had come to st anne 's school and sixth form college in welton , but were supposed to be booked in at another school in london .
despite the mix up , the group called the lions of zululand decided to stay and perform for children in welton instead :
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: mp urges government to resurface part of a180
text: a north east lincolnshire mp has asked the government to resurface parts of the a180 .
it comes as the government sets out plans to give councils in england access to a multi-billion pound fund , for local road improvements .

from junction five to the grimsby boundary , parts of the a180 are a concrete surface which causes no end of problems particularly to local residents and i 've sat in the homes of constituents as much as a mile away from the road and you can hear the constant rumble of hgv 's going over the surface . ''

documents.title: new mural at grimsby town 's football ground
text: a giant mural has been created by national and local street artists at grimsby town 's ground , blundell park .
linz and tenz ( from grimsby are two of the four artists who made the mural .
the mural is 80ft long and is designed to celebrate diversity in north east lincolnshire .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: yorkshire and humber prescription fines double in last 12 months
text: the number of fines being issued to people in yorkshire and the humber region for not paying for their prescriptions has almost doubled in 12 months .
almost 130,000 penlty notices were issued by the nhs in the past year .
the british medical association says the fines often hit those on low incomes , and there should be an overhaul of the prescribing system .

the nhs business service authority says it has a responsibility to chase up fraudulent and mistaken claims for free prescriptions as they cost the nhs millions of pounds which could be spent on frontline services .

documents.title: police begin murder inquiry in scunthorpe
text: police have launched a murder investigation after the discovery of a body around the mary street area in scunthorpe ( yesterday morning .
a post mortem examination showed kyle bell , 25 , died of stab wounds .
police are appealing for anyone with any information to come forward .

documents.title: defender tymon leaves hull city
text: hull city defender josh tymon turns down a professional contract and leaves the championship side .

documents.title: last georgian buildings on hull 's humber street to be demolished
text: the last remaining georgian buildings on humber street will be demolished .
councillors voted in favour of the plans today despite objections from historic england and the city 's civic society .
yesterday we told you about the story and the developer wykeland beal said the buildings are unstable and in an extremely poor condition .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: body recovered from grimsby docks
text: a body has been recovered from grimsby docks .
police were called at around 10:30 and crews from the humber lifeboat have been assisting with the recovery .
police are trying to establish the identity of the person .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: window cleaner makes a mint from coins
text: window cleaner makes a mint from coins

documents.title: scunthorpe united sign deal with british steel
text: scunthorpe 's steelworks has signed a partnership deal with scunthorpe united for the 2017-18 season .
it means the british steel logo will be on the club 's kit (
it follows the announcement last year that the club 's new stadium would be built from local steel .

many of our employees support the iron and when we first started working with the club they were excited to not only learn the steel they make is going into the club 's new stadium , but that the british steel logo would be emblazoned across the players ' shirts . ''

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing rapist could be in bridlington
text: the search for a convicted double rapist has moved from leicestershire to yorkshire .
sean perry ( 46 , who also uses the surnames cawthray and goldthorpe , was last seen at his probation-approved address in leicester on 19 june .
perry is known to have links to bridlington , leeds and suffolk and leicestershire police ask people to look out for him and contact them if they see him .

documents.title: power cut affects homes in hull
text: almost 1,000 homes have been affected by a power cut in the sutton road area of hull .
engineers are on site working to resolve the problem , according to northern powergrid .
it 's thought a problem with cables or equipment is responsible for the power cut .
power has now been restored to most homes , but 160 are still without electricity .
it 's hoped all power will be restored in the next hour .

documents.title: philip larkin exhibition opens at hull university
text: a new exhibition featuring items from poet philip larkin 's personal life opens in hull today .
the majority of the new collection has never been shown to the public before and includes ties and photographs from his private collection .
it 's on show at the brynmor jones library at the university of hull where larkin was the librarian .

documents.title: man in court over hull woman 's death
text: a man 's appeared in court via video link charged with the murder of a woman in hull last thursday .
joanne hemingway , 38 , died following a disturbance on beverley road (
glenn foster , 42 , of beverley road , west hull , is in custody and will face trial in november .
two women who were also arrested have been released while inquiries continue .
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull city head coach hopes to make first signings 'very soon '
text: new hull city head coach leonid slutsky has addressed the local media for the first time .
the 46-year-old russian has been learning english over the past five months .
slutsky says he 's happy to be in hull with a professional club and players and that he hopes to make some new signings very soon , possibly with news before tuesday .
he also spoke about fish and chips which he has tried near winchester - but he says he 'll make sure he tries some fish and chips in hull too .
author: Simon Clark
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: government taking 'interest ' in local hospital trust
text: scunthorpe mp nic dakin raised in the commons his concerns over northern lincolnshire and goole nhs foundation trust ( nlag ) being in special measures for quality and financial reasons .
he said the nhs have n't given nlag enough support .
earlier this year we reported that the hospital trust had become the first in the country to re-enter special measures .
in response the health minister , philip dunne ( said he 's receiving weekly updates on what 's happening :

we 're clearly disappointed that nlag has gone back into special measures , it 's one of a very small number which has emerged and then reverted and it is something therefore that we 're taking a lot of interest in . ''

documents.title: bridlington 's new lifeboat lowered in to water
text: bridlington 's new lifeboat has been lowered in to the water for the first time .
the ceremony happened yesterday at poole 's rnli headquarters in dorset , where crowds heard a crew member ring a bell eight times in keeping with tradition .
the boat will now undergo trials before being released into service .

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: sport : new hull city head coach to meet local media for first time
text: we could get a clearer indication of hull city 's initial transfer targets later today as new head coach leonid slutsky meets the local media for the first time .
the 46-year-old russian was appointed last month .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: tour de yorkshire made £ 64m for local economy
text: this year 's tour de yorkshire generated a record breaking £ 64m for the local economy , according to independent research by leeds beckett university .
the race weekend in april saw more than two million spectators line the route and spend 8 % more than last year .
those involved in organising the annual race said they 're overwhelmed by the support it 's received .

documents.title: weather : a dull and damp start
text: a cloudy start today but it should brighten up throughout the day .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning , i 'm caroline and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the area throughout the day until 18:00 .
thanks to weather watcher mags for sending us this overcast start on hornsea beach :
if you 've got anything you want to talk about please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are , by email , facebook or twitter .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: patient killed 'between staff checks '
text: patient killed 'between staff checks '

documents.title: overton puts somerset on top over yorks
text: overton puts somerset on top over yorks

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today , but we 're back tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
breaking news , sport and weather updates will continue through the evening .
before i go , let 's have a look at five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy with rain possible
text: it will remain cloudy through the evening and overnight .
rain affecting the north may spread to all parts for a time , though it should begin to become lighter and patchier later .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: man killed at mental health unit despite staff checks
text: a court 's heard a man was killed in his room at a mental health unit near scunthorpe , in between staff visits which took place every 15 minutes .
jamie reed , 26 , admits killing 60-year-old robert macneill , at great oaks ( in the early hours of 16 january but reed says it was manslaughter by diminished responsibility , and denies murder .
the trial continues .
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : hull window cleaner makes money from coins
text: richard bird turned a few pounds into thousands after learning how to spot valuable coins .
he contacted look north because he says he wants everyone to know how they can do it too :
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull could get a new secondary school
text: plans are underway to open a new secondary school in hull by september 2019 - probably in an existing building .
the school would be run by the constellation trust , which oversees the two sirius academies and six primary schools in hull .
it 's expected the school would eventually have around 800 pupils but would open in two years ' time with just 150 in year 7 .
there 's a significant shortfall in secondary school places in hull in 2019 , so we 're preparing an application so that there are sufficient school places within the city . ''

documents.title: hull infirmary not clad in same material as grenfell tower
text: hull and east yorkshire nhs trust has confirmed that the cladding used on the hull royal infirmary tower block ( is not the same aluminium cladding material which was used on grenfell tower .
samples of the building materials were sent off for testing .
the results show that it is not aluminium cladding material and that no further action is required at this stage .
however , we will continue to carry out fire safety checks across the trust 's buildings in line with the request from central government .

documents.title: £ 1m lottery funding for yorkshire and the humber
text: more than £ 1m of lottery funding has been awarded to 67 projects across yorkshire and the humber .

some of those projects include hull 's united foundation amateur boxing academy , which has been given almost £ 10,000 to teach youngster to box - giving them a recognised qualification and helping to reduce obesity .

in winterton , a group which runs activities for older people with physical disabilities and works to combat loneliness has also received £ 10,000 and in hull the catzero project has got £ 5,500 to help young people gain computer skills to help them into work .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: north lincolnshire council to spend £ 13.5m on school improvements
text: north lincolnshire council is to invest £ 13.5m on refurbishment and maintenance projects in schools across north lincolnshire in the next three years .
key projects will include building maintenance , increasing provision to meet demand for early years places and increasing provision for children with special educational needs .
further investment will also be provided to meet the demand of 30 hours free childcare for working parents of three and four-year-olds .
examples of major refurbishments expected to be completed by 2020 include :

documents.title: do you recognise this man ?
text: police are appealing for help in identifying a man ( who is wanted in connection with a common assault on alexandra pier in bridlington .
it was reported that offensive comments were made and items of food were thrown at a woman shortly before 16:00 on friday 16 june .

documents.title: hull minster electric fence art project opens
text: an art project representing the oppression experienced by victims of hate crime has opened at hull minster today .
artist annabel mccourt has designed the installation ( which looks like an electric fence , and uses modern technology to enhance the experience for the public .
it 'll be open until the end of september as part of hull uk city of culture 's freedom season .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: sport : east yorkshire 's kyle edmund through to next round of wimbledon
text: kyle edmund fought back to claim his first wimbledon win and end the hopes of fellow briton and world number 869 alex ward .
edmund , ranked 50th , won 4-6 6-3 6-2 6-1 on court three to reach the second round for the first time - at the fifth time of asking .
ward , 27 , had come through qualifying to take his place in the main draw .
edmund , 22 , goes on to face french 15th seed gael monfils or daniel brands of germany in round two .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: scunthorpe body : council suspend waste collection for five days
text: north lincolnshire council has suspended residential and trade waste collection over the next five days in the area near to where a body was found .
earlier today we told you that police had found a body in scunthorpe near mary street and investigations were ongoing .
the area affected ( includes exeter road , cliff gardens , oswald road and doncaster road boundary and all the streets within the area .
once clearance is given from the police the council will make sure all collections are brought up to date .

documents.title: yorkshire v somerset : play under way again
text: play has just resumed at scarborough between yorkshire and somerset in the first division of the county championship .
the white rose reached 110-6 in reply to the visitors ' first innings total of 268 all out .
you can listen to ball-by-ball commentary of the game here .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hull history centre sees 35 % rise in visitors
text: a recent exhibition at hull history centre has been one of the most popular since the venue opened in 2010 .
'the hessle roaders : hull 's fishing community ' displayed 100 photographs , selected from over 6,600 images , taken over a period of thirty years by hull historian dr alec gill mbe .
here 's our report from when the exhibition opened :

there were over 8,000 public visits to the history centre to see the images and over the first half of the year the history centre has seen a 35 % increase in visitors , but the hessle road photographs in june this year saw the number of visits to the history centre triple compared with june 2016 .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: cruises around bempton cliffs to see gannets feeding
text: the rspb at bempton cliffs will be putting on mini cruises for people who want to view thousands of gannet birds feeding (
the cruises will take place between 30 july and 13 august you can call 01262 422 211 to book a place or go on their website .
this is nature at its most breathtaking .
the sheer grace and majesty of gannets is incredible in itself , but to see them dive is an unforgettable moment , something our passengers are completely overwhelmed by . ''

documents.title: headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: appeal for witnesses after hate crime in hull
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a hate crime took place on cottingham road near to the gardeners arms pub in hull (
the incident involved two white men in their 20 's in a black saab car who pulled up next to a woman and made a gun shape at her whilst shouting 'bang bang ' .
the incident took place around 15:30 on thursday 29 june and police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: hull primary school going to house of lords for national sport award
text: a hull school that won an award for having more children than ever before in competitive sport is going to the house of lords .
gillshill primary came first at the yorkshire and humber awards last week and will now bid to a title nationally .
stats such as participation figures and how successful the school has been will be shown to a panel of judges .
pictured above are : charlotte jesney pe leader , david start sports coach , tilly , eloise , jack , sports ambassadors at gillshill primary and the award presenter .

documents.title: cleethorpes sunrise this morning
text: it might be a bit of a dull cloudy day but one of our weather watchers caught this brilliant sunrise in cleethorpes this morning :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: outdated views on hiv fuel stigma and discrimination - charity
text: would you go on a date with someone who has hiv ?
what about stopping in the street to give someone first aid - would hiv make you change you mind ?

apparently , loads of us still do n't understand the virus and , according to the terrence higgins trust , nearly a third of people in yorkshire and the humber region would be uncomfortable giving first aid to someone living with hiv on effective treatment .
the charity is now warning that out-of-date beliefs about hiv transmission are fuelling stigma and discrimination , which prevents people coming forward for testing .
mick mason , regional manager for the trust , says : `` it is saddening to see that , in 2017 , people in yorkshire and the humber are still being treated differently because of their hiv status . ''
joey steele , who was diagnosed three years ago , says there are still plenty of myths about the illness :
author: Shahid Hussain
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fork lift used to steal cash machine from gilberdyke
text: a cash machine has been stolen from a petrol station in gilberdyke .
police were called at 02:36 today to the incident on main road .
a fork lift has been used to pull out the cash machine and a white bmw and a black with the driver 's side rear lights out , were then seen leaving the area towards howden .
police are appealing for witnesses .
crime scene investigators from @ twitterid at a petrol station in gilberdyke where a farm vehicle has been used to steal a cash machine
it 's about time something could be done to stop things like this phil there must be something that 3 in a week now philip norton gilberdyke
hi philip , thanks for the tweet- i know there was one in hunmanby last week , where was the other do you know ?
great name by the way !
it was n't far away think was in north yorkshire remember hearing on the news yes great name phil have a good day
maybe it 's time that all cash machines were fitter with red dye to spray all the money if tampered with ?
make the cash worthless ?
wow , its like an episode of csi .

documents.title: police appeal to trace relatives of deceased scunthorpe woman
text: police are appealing for the family of a 42-year-old scunthorpe woman to come forward .
deborah anne pulley was found dead at her home on dryden way in scunthorpe on saturday .
police say ms pulley 's death was not sus and they 've so far not been able to trace her family .

documents.title: last georgian properties could be demolished on hull 's humber street
text: the last two remaining georgian properties on hull 's humber street ( could be demolished .
councillors will decide tomorrow on whether to approve an application to knock down the two buildings to make way for a new development .
historic england and the city 's civic society have objected to the proposals , saying demolition would cause irreversible harm to the character of the conservation area .
developer wykeland beal says the buildings are unstable and in an extremely poor condition .
it says the new structures will be in keeping with the rest of humber street .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: body of man found in scunthorpe
text: the body of a man has been found in scunthorpe by police in the area near mary street .
police were investigating reports that a man had been seriously injured in what was thought to have been an assault when they found the body .
a 21-year-old man was taken to hospital for treatment to injuries that are serious but not believed to be life-threatening .
police have now launched an investigation .

documents.title: sport : kyle edmund 's first round at wimbledon today
text: east yorkshire 's kyle edmund ( is in action at wimbledon later .
yesterday he spent time warming up and meeting fans .
today he 'll face fellow briton alex ward in the first round .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: mp demands answers after whistleblower 's hospital letter
text: grimsby 's mp melanie onn ( has raised new concerns about claims of poor management at the hospital trust which covers hospitals in goole , scunthorpe and grimsby .

she 's asked managers at the northern lincolnshire and goole ( nlag ) nhs foundation trust to respond to allegations made to her in an anonymous letter which raises concerns about patient safety , treatment of staff and the way complaints are dealt with .
the trust have responded and encourage anyone with any concerns to come forward :

we take all concerns and complaints very seriously and investigate each one thoroughly patient safety is our first priority and we have clear processes that ensure timely , effective and robust investigation .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: hull striker edwards returns for stanley loan
text: hull striker edwards returns for stanley loan

documents.title: weather : cloudy start but bright spells later
text: we will get some showers during this morning but it should brighten up this afternoon particularly in parts of lincolnshire .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: police cordon off street in scunthorpe town centre
text: the police have cordoned off an area in scunthorpe town centre , we do n't have any details yet but we 're expecting a police statement shortly .
some bus services have been diverted .
# scunthorpe due to police incident on mary st service 32-37-38 will be diverted along doncaster road and oswald road then normal route
parts of mary street and henry street have been cordoned of overnight and remain so this morning - police crime scene - avoid area .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to our live page for tuesday 4 july .
i 'm caroline and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the area throughout the day until 18:00 .
if you 've got anything you want to talk about please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are , by email , facebookor twitter .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: injury hampers maloney 's dons move
text: injury hampers maloney 's dons move

BBC Sport Scotland

documents.title: somerset respond after plunkett spell
text: somerset respond after plunkett spell

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today but worry not , we 'll be back from 0800 tomorrow with more of the very latest from across the county .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me for today , but we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
any breaking news will also be posted here overnight .
but before i go , here are five things we did n't know when we woke up this morning :
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : the look north headlines
text: here 's peter levy with the headlines from look north tonight .
from dog attacks on posties to patties in space @ twitterid has the headlines from @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : hundreds of postal workers attacked by dogs each year
text: dog owners are being urged to keep their dogs under control when the postman or woman calls :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: restaurants struggle with chef shortage
text: cookery programmes like the bbc 's masterchef might be popular on tv , but restaurants in east yorkshire and lincolnshire say they 're struggling to recruit chefs and catering staff .
there are more than 400 chef jobs available across east yorkshire and lincolnshire , but some restaurant owners say young people are turning away from a career in the kitchen .
some businesses say they are having to inflate salaries to attract talent .
the open university has calculated that a gap in skills has cost uk companies more than £ 2bn in the last year .
author: Leanne Brown
BBC Look North

documents.title: appeal to find missing 15-year-old
text: humberside police has started an appeal to try and help find a teenager from grimsby who has been missing for more than a week .
officers say ashley farrar , 15 , was last seen on winteringham road on sunday 25 june .
anyone with information is being asked to contact the police .

documents.title: hull man arrested over theft of cash machine in north yorkshire
text: a man from hull has been arrested in connection with the theft of a cash machine from a shop in north yorkshire , last week .
the 44-year-old man was arrested on sunday night over the theft which took place at the co-operative store in hunmanby , near filey , on friday .
the stolen cash machine has been recovered from the village of burton fleming , in east yorkshire , along with a stolen white tata police say .
the arrested man has been released on bail pending further enquiries .
anyone with more information about the theft is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: hull road closed following bus and car incident
text: a street in hull city centre has been closed following an incident .
it 's believed a car and a bus were involved in an incident on albion street this afternoon .
three ambulances and the police are at the scene .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: cash for rail improvements in northern lincolnshire
text: more than £ 15m is to be spent on improving the rail network in northern lincolnshire , so that larger containers can be carried on freight trains travelling to and from the south humber ports .
north lincolnshire council says the improvements are needed on the route between killingholme , immingham and doncaster .
the work , which is due to start in january 2019 , will see some tracks lowered and some bridges reconstructed .
the chair of the humber local enterprise partnership , lord haskins said :
this project will help to secure the long-term competitiveness of the south humber ports and create opportunities for further development . ''

documents.title: local mps return to jeremy corbyn 's shadow cabinet
text: two of our local labour mps have been offered jobs on jeremy corbyn 's front bench , a year after joining the mass resignation of shadow ministers following the eu referendum .
great grimsby 's melanie onn has been appointed as a housing spokesperson .
there is also a job for karl turner , the mp for hull east , who returned to the front bench last year after joining the mass resignation in june 2016 .
he will be a transport spokesperson .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: first hull pattie in space
text: no , you 're not seeing things .
this is a pattie and chips on the edge of space !
the hull delicacy was sent more than 30km in to the atmosphere as part of a bbc radio humberside space mission .
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: tiny kitten rescued from tree finds new home with fireman that saved him
text: how cute is this little guy ?
buddy was rescued after getting stuck 20ft up a tree in brigg last week .
the rspca says it took 90 minutes to retrieve him , and now he 's been offered a new home by the firefighter who helped save him .

documents.title: mental health unit for young people to be built in hull
text: plans have been announced for a new mental health unit for young people in the humber region .
nhs england says the multi-million pound contract will see the development of a new mental health service , including 11 in-patient beds .
it follows a long campaign by dozens of parents whose children had to travel more than 100 miles for specialist treatment .
in 2013 the west end unit in hessle ( closed its inpatient beds , because nhs managers said they were no longer fit for purpose .
the proposed site would be near the centre of hull and would work alongside the existing community child and adolescence mental health services .
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and bright
text: it should stay mostly dry this afternoon , with some bright spells .
feeling pleasant , with highs of 20c
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: man seriously injured in cleethorpes assault
text: a man is seriously ill in hospital following an assault in cleethorpes .
humberside police say the 47-year-old man suffered serious injuries in the incident on rufford road in the early hours of saturday 1 july .
officers say one man has been arrested and inquiries are continuing .

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what goes up : hull 's 'space pattie ' found in a lincolnshire field
text: after making an epic journey into space , a portion of hull 's famous pattie and chips has been tracked down to a wheat field in wragby , lincolnshire .
it does n't look too bad considering it soared more than 30km into the atmosphere before crashing back down to earth .
it took a litte while to track it down , but the capsule carrying the pattie was still intact :
the space mission was all part of a bbc radio humberside project to get more young people interested in science .
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: deal to 'secure future ' of scunthorpe steel mill
text: a scunthorpe steel mill has been rescued from administration after being bought by metals giant the liberty house group .
caparo merchant bar , which employs 145 people at two rolling mills in the town , went into administration in october 2015 .
liberty house says it 's confident the purchase will secure the future of the company .

documents.title: the space pattie has landed
text: after soaring to more than 30km , a portion of hull 's famous pattie and chips has crashed back down to earth .
the operation pattie team are now trying find it and they think it is somewhere in this field near wragby in lincolnshire .
the dish was launched in to space as part of a science project by bbc radio humberside .
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: murder charge for street assault suspect
text: murder charge for street assault suspect

documents.title: man charged with hull murder appears in court
text: a man has appeared in court , charged with the murder of a woman in hull .
joanne hemingway ( 39 , suffered serious injuries outside a flat on beverley road on thursday and died later in hospital .
glenn foster , 42 , of beverley road appeared at hull magistrates ' court this morning .
the case has been referred to hull crown court , where mr foster is due to appear on wednesday .
he was remanded in custody .
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest from the newsroom :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: anti-social behaviour fund for ne lincolnshire
text: a new fund to tackle anti-social behaviour has been set up in north east lincolnshire .
organisations that work to reduce violent crime and domestic abuse can apply for a share of £ 84,000 .
it is being funded by the humberside police and crime commissioner .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : we have lift-off for pattie and chips in space
text: and it 's off !
a portion of hull 's favourite pattie and chips is making its way to space as part of a bbc radio humberside science mission .
this is the moment children from craven primary school helped with the launch :
it 's off !
our pattie and chips is on the way to the edge of space !
# operationpattie
@ twitterid remember the pattie at hull city hall ?
# operationpattie # dontforgetthechips
is this in reaction to that prescott speech demanding we send fried goods into space , not because it 's easy , but because it 's hard ?
let 's just hope the seagulls do n't get to it

documents.title: postal worker 's plea for people to control dogs
text: there have been more than 30 dog attacks on postal workers in east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire in the past year .
that 's according to figures from royal mail , which is urging dog owners to keep their pets away from delivery workers .
clare hardcastle has been working as a postie in south cave for 19 years and has been bitten by dogs four times .
she said dog owners need to take more control of their pets :
i go on to a property and i am literally scared .
people need to be aware that we are coming on to their property and all we are asking is for people to keep their dogs in . ''
author: Matthew Bone
Video Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: pattie and chips on space mission
text: a portion of pattie and chips , the famous hull delicacy , will be launched into space this morning as part of bbc radio humberside 's space mission .
a high altitude weather balloon will reach a height of approximately 30km above the earth and will collect environmental data during its flight .
the project is designed to inspire children in the region to become interested in science .
hundreds of professional astronomers will gather in hull this month for the royal astronomical society 's national meeting .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather : mostly dry with sunny spells
text: any cloud or rain lingering around this morning should clear to leave a dry day with some sunny spells .
feeling rather pleasant , with a light north-westerly breeze .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to our live coverage on monday 3 july .
i 'm suzy and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the area throughout the day until 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch you can .
just send me an email or a message on facebook or twitter .
send me your or any news or info about what 's happening where you are .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live
